sense.gloss: to hang up (e.g. a coat, a picture on the wall), to let hang, to suspend (from), to hoist (e.g. sail), to raise (e.g. flag)
to put on (e.g. a blanket), to put on top of, to cover, to lay, to spread
to put on (glasses, etc.), to wear (a necklace, etc.)
to make (a call)
to spend (time, money), to expend, to use
to pour (liquid) onto, to sprinkle (powder or spices) onto, to splash, to throw (e.g. water) onto
to turn on (an engine, radio, etc.), to set (a dial, alarm clock, etc.), to put on (a DVD, song, etc.), to use (a device, implement, etc.)
to cause (someone inconvenience, trouble, etc.), to burden (someone), to impose
to multiply (arithmetic operation)
to secure (e.g. lock)
to take a seat, to sit, to rest (something on something else), to support (something on something else)
to bind
to wager, to bet, to risk, to stake, to gamble
to put an effect (spell, anaesthetic, etc.) on
to hold (a play, festival, etc.)
to hold an emotion for (pity, hope, etc.)
to argue (in court), to deliberate (in a meeting), to present (e.g. idea to a conference, etc.)
to increase further
to catch (in a trap, etc.)
to set atop
to erect (a makeshift building)
to apply (insurance)
to pun (on a word), to use (a word) as a pivot word, to play on words
to be partway doing ..., to begin (but not complete) ..., to be about to ...
to address (someone), to direct (something, to someone), to do (something, to someone)

sdata.j: ↑偶数|↑↓ぐうすう↓↑掛↑↓か↓ける|↑奇数↑↓きすう↓は↑偶数↑↓ぐうすう↓、↑奇数|↑↓きすう↓↑掛↑↓か↓ける|↑奇数↑↓きすう↓は↑奇数↑↓きすう↓。
sdata.e: Even times odd is even, odd times odd is odd.

sdata.j: マイクは↑由美↑↓ゆみ↓に↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|のがたのしかった。
sdata.e: It was pleasant for Mike to talk to Yumi.

sdata.j: これは|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|のにたいそう↑頑丈↑↓がんじょう↓ないすだ。
sdata.e: This is a very sturdy chair to sit in.
Four multiplied by two is eight.

sdata.j: ↑３↑↓さん↓に↑５↑↓ご↓を|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|と↑１５↑↓じゅうご↓になる。
sdata.e: 3 multiplied by 5 is 15.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓はあなたを↑時々↑↓ときどき↓↑見|掛↑↓みか↓ける|。
sdata.e: I see you every now and then.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑非常↑↓ひじょう↓に↑急↑↓いそ↓いでいたので、ドアの↑鍵↑↓かぎ↓を|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|のを↑忘↑↓わす↓れてしまった。
sdata.e: I was in such a hurry that I forgot to lock the door.

sdata.j: ↑怒↑↓おこ↓っているときに↑彼↑↓かれ↓に↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|のは↑無理↑↓むり↓だ。
sdata.e: There's no talking to him when he's angry.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓にあまり↑期待↑↓きたい↓を|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|な。
sdata.e: Don't expect too much of him.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓に↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|ほうがよいだろう。
sdata.e: It would be better for you to speak to him.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑私↑↓わたし↓に↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|ような↑態度↑↓たいど↓を↑示↑↓しめ↓したが↑何↑↓なに↓も↑言↑↓い↓わなかった。
sdata.e: He made as if to speak to me but said nothing.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑誰↑↓だれ↓の↑言↑↓い↓うことも↑聞↑↓き↓こうとしない。↑石像↑↓せきぞう↓にでも↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|ほうがましだ。
sdata.e: He will not listen to any of us; you might as well talk to a figure of stone.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓には↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|↑人↑↓じん↓がいない。
sdata.e: She has no one to speak to.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓に↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|のはよそう。
sdata.e: Let's not talk to her.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑彼↑↓かれ↓が↑他↑↓ほか↓の↑女↑↓おんな↓の↑子↑↓こ↓に↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|と↑嫉妬↑↓しっと↓した。
sdata.e: She was jealous when he talked to another girl.

sdata.j: ↑必↑↓かなら↓ずドアに↑鍵↑↓かぎ↓を|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|ようにして↑下↑↓くだ↓さい。
sdata.e: Please make sure that the door is locked.

sdata.j: ↑妻↑↓つま↓は↑魚↑↓さかな↓のオードブルが↑好↑↓す↓きだからね、↑釣↑↓つ↓りに↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|ときはお↑許↑↓ゆる↓しが↑出↑↓で↓やすいんだよね。
sdata.e: My wife loves fish hors d'oeuvre, so it's easier for me to get a kitchen pass for my fishing.

sdata.j: ↑盛大↑↓せいだい↓な↑溜息↑↓ためいき↓をつきながら、テーブルの↑上↑↓じょう↓にどさどさとパンを↑置↑↓お↓き、↑椅子↑↓いす↓にどっかりと↑腰|掛↑↓こしか↓ける|。
sdata.e: Heaving a great sigh I plunk my bread on the table and flump onto the chair.

sdata.j: そんな↑服↑↓ふく↓で↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|の？なんだかカッコ↑悪↑↓わる↓いなあ。
sdata.e: Going out with those clothes? They look kinda bad.

sdata.j: そんな↑服↑↓ふく↓で↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|の？なんだかカッコ↑悪↑↓わる↓いなあ。
sdata.e: Are you going out in those clothes? How uncool!

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑彼↑↓かれ↓が↑他↑↓ほか↓の↑女↑↓おんな↓の↑子↑↓こ↓に↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|と↑嫉妬↑↓しっと↓した。
sdata.e: She was jealous from him talking to another girl.

sdata.j: マイクは↑由美↑↓ゆみ↓に↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|のがたのしかった。
sdata.e: Mike had fun talking to Yumi.

sdata.j: マイクは↑由美↑↓ゆみ↓に↑話↑↓はな↓し|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|のがたのしかった。
sdata.e: Mike had a good time talking to Yumi.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓たちは↑罠↑↓わな↓を↑仕|掛↑↓しか↓ける|べきだ。
sdata.e: We should set a trap.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑壁↑↓かべ↓にカレンダーを|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|。
sdata.e: I hang the calendar on the wall.

sdata.j: ↑明日↑↓あした↓は↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|の？
sdata.e: Are you going out tomorrow?

sdata.j: ↑今日↑↓きょう↓は↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|の？
sdata.e: Are you going out today?

sdata.j: もう↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|↑準備↑↓じゅんび↓できた？
sdata.e: Are you ready to go yet?

sdata.j: ↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|↑準備↑↓じゅんび↓できてないの？
sdata.e: Aren't you ready to go?

sdata.j: ↑今日↑↓きょう↓の↑夜↑↓よる↓は、トムと↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|↑予定↑↓よてい↓なんだ。
sdata.e: I'm going out with Tom tonight.

sdata.j: ↑明日↑↓あした↓↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|↑準備↑↓じゅんび↓はできてるの？
sdata.e: Can you be ready to leave tomorrow?

sdata.j: もうとっくに↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|↑時間↑↓じかん↓だよ。
sdata.e: It's high time you got going.

sdata.j: ケモナーであれば↑一↑↓いち↓↑度↑↓ど↓は↑全↑↓すべ↓ての↑住人↑↓じゅうにん↓がファースーツを↑着↑↓き↓て、↑外↑↓そと↓へ↑出|掛↑↓でか↓ける|↑世界↑↓せかい↓を↑想像↑↓そうぞう↓するでしょう！
sdata.e: If you are a furry then at least once you must have imagined a world you can leave into where every resident is wearing a fur suit.

sdata.j: ↑声|↑↓こえ↓↑掛↑↓か↓ける|のが↑面倒↑↓めんどう↓くさいってどれだけものぐさなんだよ。
sdata.e: You couldn't be bothered to say anything to them? God, just how lazy are you?

sdata.j: また↑床↑↓ゆか↓にワックス|↑掛↑↓か↓ける|の↑忘↑↓わす↓れたの？
sdata.e: Did you forget to wax the floor again?
